alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 10:52AM EDT until October 01 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline around the times of high tide, especially with the morning high tide cycles. * WHERE...Southern Queens and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EDT Sunday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. * BEACH EROSION AND FLOODING IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 6 ft will cause significant beach erosion and escarpment, with scattered areas of beach flooding and dune erosion during the time of high tide. The potential for localized overwashes is low. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor flooding may also occur with the Monday morning high tide cycle. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
